etymologies: early 17th century: from modern Latin jonquilla or French jonquille, from Spanish junquillo, diminutive of junco, from Latin juncus ‘rush, reed’

definitions: a widely cultivated narcissus with clusters of small fragrant yellow flowers and cylindrical leaves, native to southern Europe and northeastern Africa.
shortDefinitions: narcissus with clusters of small fragrant yellow flowers and cylindrical leaves, native to southern Europe
